intro: Hesperastragalus reflexus, commonly known as the bentleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open plains. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and the pods that develop after flowering are usually hairy and contain several seeds. Hesperastragalus reflexus is often found in disturbed or dry habitats and is adapted to survive in low-nutrient soils.
